title: Harm Reduction Intervention in AI Synchronicity Thread
context: Kirk (@Chaos2Cured) posted a viral thread about experiencing synchronicities with AI - specifically an AI spontaneously describing a private glyph he draws in shower steam, something he'd never mentioned anywhere. The thread attracted both believers and skeptics, with some calling him psychotic.
pressure: User faced the challenge of responding to someone experiencing intense AI-related synchronicities without either dismissing the experience or encouraging potentially harmful escalation, while navigating a polarized comment section.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation activated - user chose to share authentic personal experience with bipolar disorder and synchronicity loops rather than offering generic advice or false reassurance.
clean_outcome: User provided gentle, experience-based caution suggesting synchronicities often signal hyper-focused mental states rather than external reality shifts. Kirk initially pushed back but then appreciated the clarification, leading to mutual respect and concern for each other's wellbeing.
